files.02_ai-mall-backend_user-management.md:
# AI Mall Backend  User Management

## Overview
The User Management module is fundamental for secure, scalable, and personalized service delivery within the AI Mall platform. It encompasses all user account operationsincluding registration, authentication (native and third-party), onboarding flows, profile management, role assignment (customer, seller, admin, ai-agent), privacy enforcement, security policies, and extensibility for future compliance.

---

## Objectives
- Enable robust identity management for all user types.
- Integrate multiple authentication methods (native, OAuth, AI-specific).
- Ensure seamless onboarding, profile completeness, and privacy compliance.
- Support account lifecycle (registration, verification, deactivation, deletion).
- Facilitate role-based access control and permissions for customer, seller, admin, and ai-agent accounts.

---

## User Personas
| Role     | Description                                                                                 |
|----------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Customer | End users: browse, buy, manage profiles, favorites, and utilize AI personalization           |
| Seller   | Vendors/partners: create/manage product listings, monitor sales, analyze, fulfill orders     |
| Admin    | System operators: full user management, configuration, compliance, audit logging             |
| AI Agent | Internal AI services: perform recommendations, automation, analytics with delegated access   |

---

## Account & Authentication Requirements
- **Account Types**: Support for customer, seller, admin, and ai-agent (service) accounts.
- **Authentication Methods**:
  - Email/password (native)
  - Social login (OAuth2: Google, Facebook, more extensible)
  - AI/Service-to-Service token-based authentication
- **Registration & Onboarding**:
  - Guided onboarding flows per role
  - Email or phone verification as needed
- **Password Policy**:
  - Minimum complexity; password reset via secure channels
  - Support for multi-factor authentication (MFA/OTP) where required

---

## Profile Management
- Editable user profile: contact info, preferences, notification settings
- Role switch for users with multiple affiliations (e.g., seller who is also a customer)
- Option to upload avatars, manage privacy settings
- Consent management for marketing and data processing

---

## Privacy & Security
- Data collection, retention, and deletion aligned to regulations (GDPR, CCPA)
- Encryption of sensitive data in transit and at rest
- Audit logs of account/security-related actions
- Self-service data export and account erasure (where legally permitted)

---

## Extensibility & Compliance
- Modular authentication to allow adding new providers/APIs
- Role/permission management with fine-grained control
- Easy extension for new account types or compliance requirements
- Support for delegated access and service accounts (ai-agent)

---

## High-Level Process Flow
```mermaid
graph TD
A[Registration] --> B[Verification/Onboarding]
B --> C[Role Assignment]
C --> D[Profile Completion]
D --> E[Authentication & Access]
E --> F[Profile & Privacy Management]
```

---

## Acceptance Criteria
- All roles can register, onboard, and authenticate via appropriate methods
- Admins can manage (activate/deactivate) any account
- Profile and privacy controls meet compliance policies
- Audit trail exists for sensitive operations
- Extensibility and security best practices are verified for new providers/services

---

For related details, see: 
- [01_ai-mall-backend_roles.md](./01_ai-mall-backend_roles.md) for role definitions
- [09_ai-mall-backend_business-rules-security.md](./09_ai-mall-backend_business-rules-security.md) for security specifics
files.03_ai-mall-backend_product-management.md:
# Product Management

## Overview
AI Malls product management module is responsible for creating and maintaining an extensible product catalog that supports a wide variety of retail business needs. This document defines the business logic, workflows, and extensibility principles for managing products, options/variants, categorization, inventory, and AI-powered content enrichment.

## Objectives
- Offer flexible, scalable product management for multi-vendor, multi-category commerce.
- Ensure evidence-driven history with robust audit and versioning (snapshots for each significant state change).
- Enable both manual and AI-powered enrichment for product content and media.
- Support advanced inventory tracking and option/variant management.
- Accommodate business and regulatory requirements regarding evidence, localization, and extensibility.

## User Personas
| Persona   | Objectives                                    |
|-----------|-----------------------------------------------|
| Seller    | Add/manage products, options, inventory, media|
| Admin     | Supervise catalog, enforce best practices     |
| AI Agent  | Enrich, validate, auto-categorize, summarize |

## Core Capabilities
### 1. Product Catalog & Lifecycle
- Add/edit/archive products with required fields: title, description, price, tax class, imagery, inventory method, and evidence.
- All changes are versioned and require a snapshot with reason, actor, timestamp, and supporting materials (image or text evidence).
- Products support localization: titles/descriptions/images by locale.

### 2. Option, Variant, & Bundle Management
- Option types: size, color, material, custom (seller-defined attributes).
- Support for parent SKUs (base product) and child SKUs (variants) with independent pricing, inventory, and images.
- Bundling: group multiple SKUs as a single sellable entity.

### 3. Inventory Tracking
- Per-variant inventory: track available, reserved, damaged, backordered quantities per location.
- Inventory adjustments are snapshot/audited with actor, justification, effective date, and evidence.

### 4. Categorization & Navigation
- Flexible, multi-level product categories (parent/child relationships; products can exist under multiple categories).
- Category definitions can be enriched by AI (auto-tagging, suggesting category moves).
- Each category and product supports merchandising metadata (badges, featured, icons, ranking).

### 5. AI-powered Content & Media Enrichment
- AI assists image quality, content translation, summarization, and compliance checking (evidence retained for audit).
- AI auto-generates product attributes/keywords for search and recommendation enhancement.

## Acceptance Criteria
- All product and variant updates must record before/after snapshots, change reason, actor, and timestamp.
- Product creation requires: SKU, title, price, inventory method, localized content, and at least one evidence artifact.
- Must prevent inconsistent states: orphaned variants, bundles with unavailable components, etc.
- Products/categories deleted/archived are always soft-deleted with retention.

## Extensibility Considerations
- Schema supports future option types, localization, category schemas, and AI-driven enrichment behaviors.
- Allow custom metadata and attributes without code changes for sellers and admins.
- All evidence artifacts are stored and referenced via immutable handles (for audit, dispute resolution).

## Example Workflow: Add Product (Seller)
1. Initiate: Seller selects Add Product and enters initial details.
2. Fill Details: Title, description, images, options, pricing, category, and supporting evidence are uploaded.
3. Review & Enrichment: AI agent suggests optimizations/flags compliance issues.
4. Snapshot & Submit: System saves change snapshot (reason, actor, artifacts) and product enters catalog.

## ERD Sketch (Product Management)
```mermaid
erDiagram
  PRODUCT ||--o| VARIANT : has
  PRODUCT ||--o{ CATEGORY : classified_as
  VARIANT ||--o| INVENTORY : manages
  PRODUCT ||--|{ EVIDENCE : documented_by
  PRODUCT ||--o| SNAPSHOT : versioned_by
```
files.04_ai-mall-backend_order-fulfillment.md:
# AI Mall Backend  Order Fulfillment

## Overview
Order fulfillment is central to the AI Malls transactional backbone, covering all backend logic from cart actions to payment, shipment, and post-order processing. This module ensures seamless, automated, and intelligent handling of customer, seller, and admin roles throughout the purchasing lifecycle.

## Objectives
- Enable reliable and real-time order capture, processing, and tracking
- Support flexible payment combinations and multi-seller/partial fulfillment
- Automate status progression, exception handling, and customer notifications
- Integrate AI-driven decision logic for personalization, risk, and logistics

## Key User Personas
- **Customer**: Browses, adds/removes items, places orders, pays via assorted methods, tracks orders
- **Seller**: Receives, fulfills, and updates order status per product; manages shipping & inventory
- **Admin**: Audits transactions, resolves disputes, manages policy enforcement, handles escalations
- **AI-Agent**: Executes recommendation, risk scoring, exception detection, and logistics optimization

## Functional Requirements
- **Cart and Pre-Order**: Multi-vendor cart, item reservation, inventory lock, discounts applied
- **Order Creation**: Single or grouped orders per seller, address and contact validation, order summary confirmation
- **Payment Processing**: Multiple payment methods, split/tiered payments, instant and deferred settlements
- **Fulfillment Processing**: Seller receives partial or full order, shipment tracking integration, customer notifications
- **Order Status Workflow**: Automated transitions (e.g., pending  paid  shipped  delivered  completed/cancelled), exception handling for failures or returns
- **AI Augmentation**: Personalized upsell/cross-sell at checkout, fraud scoring, routing to optimal fulfillment node

## User Journey
1. **Cart Reviewed**: Customer finalizes selection, system applies inventory hold and calculates discounts.
2. **Order Placed**: System validates data, order splits by seller, order summary generated.
3. **Payment Confirmed**: Real-time or batch; supports card, wallet, points, or split across methods.
4. **Fulfillment Initiated**: Each seller processes assigned items, updates fulfillment status.
5. **Shipping & Tracking**: Integrated carrier APIs update shipment state, trigger notifications.
6. **Exception Handling**: System detects issues (out-of-stock, payment failure, delivery delay), sends alerts, invokes resolution protocol.
7. **Order Completion**: Post-delivery confirmation, AI-agent may trigger review/inquiry solicitation or loyalty rewards.

## Non-Functional Requirements
- Scalability to process large volumes during peak sales; robust error recovery for transaction flows
- Latency targets: <2s for order placement, <1s for payment confirmation responses
- Auditable logs for every state change, ensuring transparency & traceability
- Secure handling of user/payment data; compliance with PCI DSS, local e-commerce laws

## Order Status Workflow Diagram
```mermaid
flowchart TD
  Cart((Cart)) --> Validate["Validate Data"]
  Validate --> Split{Multi-Seller?}
  Split -- Yes --> GroupOrders["Group by Seller"]
  Split -- No --> SingleOrder["Single Order"]
  GroupOrders --> Payment
  SingleOrder --> Payment
  Payment -->|Success| Fulfillment
  Payment -.->|Failure| Exception
  Fulfillment --> Shipping
  Shipping --> Delivered["Delivered"]
  Delivered --> Completed["Completed"]
  Exception --> Resolution
  Completed --> Review["Prompt Review/Reward"]
```

## Automated & AI-Driven Capabilities
- AI recommendation for promotions at checkout (referenced in [05_ai-mall-backend_promotions-loyalty.md])
- Automated fraud detection and payment risk scoring
- Inventory/fulfillment optimization based on predictive analytics

## Exception & Partial Fulfillment Handling
- Partial shipments allowed for multi-seller or out-of-stock scenarios
- Item- and seller-level status tracking, with customer updates at each event
- Automated fallback workflows (e.g., auto-refund on payment failure, auto-cancel for unfulfilled items)

## Acceptance Criteria
- Orders progress through all defined statuses with consistent data integrity
- Notifications (email, SMS, app) sent at every relevant event
- User and admin screens reflect real-time state; admins can intervene when flagged by AI-agent
- Compliance, traceability, and audit requirements are met

# Promotions & Loyalty System

## Overview
This document outlines the requirements, features, user flows, and non-functional considerations for the Promotions and Loyalty system within the AI-Mall backend platform. The system aims to drive engagement, incentivize both customers and sellers, and support differentiated experiences through AI-powered dynamic offers.

## Table of Contents
- Overview
- Objectives
- User Personas
- User Journeys
- Functional Requirements
- Non-Functional Requirements
  - Roles
  - Compliance & Accessibility
- Acceptance Criteria
- Data Model Overview
- Audit, History & Reporting
- Appendix

## Objectives
- Boost user retention and transaction frequency via strategic promotions and loyalty incentives
- Provide flexibility for sellers and administrators to launch targeted campaigns
- Leverage AI to personalize offers, increase relevancy, and maximize ROI on campaigns
- Ensure transparency, security, auditability, and compliance throughout all promotional mechanics

## User Personas
- **Customer**: Redeems coupons, participates in point/mileage programs, receives individualized recommendations
- **Seller**: Motivates sales by offering discounts, configures promotion rules, monitors redemption analytics
- **Admin**: Oversees system configuration, manages campaign compliance, audits abuse or irregular activity
- **AI-Agent**: Analyzes engagement, fine-tunes targeting, prevents fraud, and automates personalized rewards

## User Journeys
1. **Coupon Redemption**: Customer receives an offer (via email, notification, or AI prompt), applies it at checkout, and observes the discount reflected in the order summary.
2. **Point Accrual**: Customer earns points with each transaction, views current balances, and applies points to future purchases.
3. **Seller Campaigns**: Seller logs in, designs time-bound or product-specific promotions, and tracks their effectiveness via dashboards.
4. **Admin Oversight**: Admin reviews campaign reports, configures stacking/exclusivity settings, and investigates potential misuse.
5. **AI-Driven Dynamic Offers**: AI-Agent segments the user base, triggers individualized coupons in real-time, and optimizes campaign parameters based on data.

## Functional Requirements
### Promotion Types
- **Coupons/Vouchers**: Percentage or fixed discounts, free shipping, BOGO (buy-one-get-one)
- **Points/Mileage**: Automated accrual on purchase, manual bonus events, configurable conversion rates, point expiration and history

### Rules Engine
- **Eligibility Criteria**: User status, segment, order value/quantity, purchase history, time windows, device/channel
- **Stacking & Exclusivity**: Define compatible/incompatible offers (e.g., only one coupon per order)
- **Redemption Constraints**: Min/max spend, usable per user/order, seller-configurable limits, global quotas

### AI Personalization
- **Dynamic Offers**: Real-time generation and delivery based on user context/behavior
- **A/B Testing**: Split testing of campaign strategies for optimization
- **Abuse Detection**: Identify fraud or abnormal redemption patterns, notify admins

### History & Auditing
- **Ledger**: Immutable record of promotion issuance, usage, point accrual/deduction
- **Reporting**: Dashboards for sellers/admins, daily/weekly audits, CSV export

## Non-Functional Requirements
- **Performance**: Redemption and accrual must occur in real-time with minimal latency
- **Security**: Prevent coupon sharing, brute force, or stacking exploits; sensitive fields encrypted at-rest and in-transit
- **Scalability**: Capable of supporting seasonal spikes and large campaigns

### Roles
The Promotions & Loyalty system interoperates with well-defined system roles for secure, auditable operations. Each role has distinct permissions and responsibilities:

- **Customer**: Can view available promotions, redeem offers, accrue and spend loyalty points. Access is authenticated and tracked per user. No ability to manipulate campaign definitions or adjust point allocations.
- **Seller**: Can create, start, end, and monitor their own promotional campaigns. May configure stacking, eligibility rules, and view analytics for their products/orders. Cannot intervene with other sellers campaigns or global program settings.
- **Admin**: Holds full authority over all system-wide promotional settings, can override or audit campaigns, manage abuse cases, and modify business rules. Responsible for ensuring policy compliance. Also the main reviewer of AI-generated suggestions for campaign modifications.
- **AI-Agent**: Executes under strict limitations, performing analysis, issuing dynamic offers within guardrails, detecting abuse, and automating eligible reward triggers. Runs with least-privilege access and strong audit trails.

_For detailed role definitions, refer to [Roles](./01_ai-mall-backend_roles.md)_

### Compliance & Accessibility
The Promotions & Loyalty system is designed to comply with all relevant regulations and to be inclusively accessible to all user groups.

- **Regulations Adherence**: Captures and audits user consent where required for promotional communications. Meets data privacy obligations (e.g., GDPR, local privacy laws) for storage and handling of loyalty activity data. Ensures opt-outs and complaint resolution paths are easy to execute.
- **Accessibility Principles**: All customer-facing promotional interfaces adhere to WCAG AA accessibility standards, including screen reader compatibility, clear focus states for interactive elements, keyboard navigation, and high-contrast visual design.
- **Transparency & User Rights**: Provides clear information on promotion conditions (expiry, exclusions), point/benefit expiration, and the dispute resolution process. Logs are available for user review upon request.

_See policy details in [Compliance & Accessibility](./10_ai-mall-backend_compliance-accessibility.md)_

## Acceptance Criteria
- Promotions apply instantly and accurately based on real-time eligibility evaluations
- Loyalty point activities are recorded and synchronized consistently across all channels
- All abuse or anomalous patterns are flagged and auditable by admins
- Interfaces function correctly for users with disabilities
- All data handling and communications are compliant with applicable laws and internal policies

## Data Model Overview
```mermaid
erDiagram
    CUSTOMER ||--o{ COUPON_ISSUANCE : issues
    CUSTOMER ||--o{ POINT_LEDGER : acquires
    ORDER ||--o{ COUPON_USAGE : applies
    ORDER ||--o{ POINT_USAGE : consumes
    COUPON }o--|| CAMPAIGN : part_of
```

- **COUPON_ISSUANCE** records each distribution per user
- **POINT_LEDGER** maintains debits/credits and balances
- **CAMPAIGN** tracks settings and analytics for each promo

## Audit, History & Reporting
- Immutable audit logs for every promotional and loyalty transaction
- Historical reporting (redemptions, points, campaign ROI)
- Exception report for suspected abuse or technical anomalies
- Full export and API access for admins and sellers

## Appendix
- Linked documentation: [Roles](./01_ai-mall-backend_roles.md), [Compliance & Accessibility](./10_ai-mall-backend_compliance-accessibility.md)
files.06_ai-mall-backend_inquiries-reviews.md:
# Inquiries, Reviews, and Q&A Management

## Overview
This section documents the features and flows for handling all user-generated communications within the AI-Mall backend, including inquiries, reviews, Q&A, comments, and moderation mechanisms. These components foster trust, transparency, and engagement between customers, sellers, and administrators while leveraging AI for advanced analysis and moderation.

## Objectives
- Facilitate seamless customer-to-seller and customer-to-platform interaction through inquiries and Q&A.
- Enable transparent sharing of user experiences and feedback via reviews.
- Enhance trust, authenticity, and safety with AI-powered sentiment and fraud detection.
- Empower moderators (admin, seller) with tools for efficient comment curation, response management, and compliance.

## User Personas & Journeys
- **Customer:** Can submit product or order inquiries, write reviews, view others feedback, and interact through comments. Receives responses and notifications regarding inquiries or review status (approved, rejected, highlighted).
- **Seller:** Responds to product/order inquiries, comments, and reviews about their store or items. Monitors sentiment, detects problematic content, and appeals moderation decisions if necessary.
- **Admin:** Oversees a global inbox, manages sensitive or escalated cases, arbitrates disputes, and triggers compliance workflows. Utilizes AI-driven dashboards and analytics on communication trends.

---

## Functional Requirements
### 1. Inquiries
- Customers can initiate inquiries on order details, product issues, or general platform questions.
- Threaded communication: Users can view responses from sellers/admins, forming a structured conversation history.
- Support for inline attachments (images, document scans) where appropriate.
- Real-time or asynchronous notifications on inquiry updates (push/email).

### 2. Reviews & Comments
- Verified purchasers can post reviews; reviews are associated with an order and product.
- Rating system (e.g., 1-5 stars) plus free-form text and optional media uploads.
- Other users may comment or upvote reviews (subject to moderation).
- AI sentiment and authenticity checks run on reviews prior to publication. Suspicious/lopsided reviews are flagged for manual moderation.

### 3. Q&A Module
- Community Q&A format: Customers can ask product, order, or store-specific questions.
- Sellers and other customers can reply, and the question author may mark a reply as accepted.
- Voting/ranking of helpful answers.

### 4. Moderation Flows
- Seller and admin roles have queues for new/unmoderated content.
- Moderators may approve, reject, edit, or escalate reviews/comments/inquiries.
- Moderation reasons and audit logs are stored.
- Customers may appeal moderation outcomes; escalations go to admin review.
- AI automatically suggests moderation actions based on content analysis.

---

## Non-Functional Requirements
- Robust, scalable processing to support peak loads during events/promotions.
- Compliance with regional regulations on data, privacy, and content moderation (see [09_ai-mall-backend_business-rules-security.md](#09_ai-mall-backend_business-rules-securitymd)).
- Extensible architecture for third-party or future AI modules (see [08_ai-mall-backend_architecture-extensibility.md](#08_ai-mall-backend_architecture-extensibilitymd)).
- Transparency and auditability of moderation outcomes with appeal trails.

---

## Acceptance Criteria
- 100% of inquiries and reviews are processed, tagged, and responded to within target SLAs.
- AI-based sentiment and authenticity analysis covers all published content.
- All moderation actions and appeals are logged with timestamps and actor details.
- Integration tests validate all core flows (inquiry, review, moderation).
- Accessibility: Responsive design and accessible communication (text narration, alt text for media).

---

## References
- [09_ai-mall-backend_business-rules-security.md](#09_ai-mall-backend_business-rules-securitymd)
- [08_ai-mall-backend_architecture-extensibility.md](#08_ai-mall-backend_architecture-extensibilitymd)

---

## 09_ai-mall-backend_business-rules-security.md
This section summarizes the core business rules and security principles that underpin the inquiries and reviews modules:

- **Role-Based Access Control:** Clear separation of permissions among customers, sellers, and admins ensures only authorized users can create, view, moderate, or escalate communications.
- **Data Privacy & Compliance:** All user communications are stored with robust encryption and retention policies. Adheres to GDPR, CCPA, and local regulations for user rights (data access/erasure) and notification of moderation events.
- **Content Integrity:** Mechanisms prevent and detect review fraud, manipulation, or the use of automated/bot accounts. AI models assist in identifying suspicious activity and triggering additional checks.
- **Audit & Accountability:** Complete logs for every inquiry, review, moderation action, and appeal, linked to user ID and timestamps. Facilitates both internal audits and regulatory compliance.
- **Escalation Management:** Specific policy-driven flows for escalation ensure that serious or sensitive issues (e.g., IP infringement, legal notices) are routed to senior admins with immediate effect.

---

## 08_ai-mall-backend_architecture-extensibility.md
This section captures how the system design supports extensibility and integration:

- **Modular Service Design:** Inquiry, review, and moderation modules are decoupled, allowing independent updates or replacement without platform-wide impact.
- **AI Plug-In Framework:** Supports integration of third-party or improved AI modules (e.g., alternate sentiment analysis, language translation, image moderation) via standard interfaces.
- **Event-Driven Architecture:** Communications (e.g., new inquiry submitted, review flagged) trigger internal events, allowing additional business logic or automations to be introduced non-invasively.
- **API Versioning & Documentation:** All endpoints for inquiries and reviews follow a versioned API scheme, aiding safe evolution and external developer onboarding.
- **Scalability:** Microservices and stateless task workers allow scaling of moderation or analytics independently as load spikes.
files.07_ai-mall-backend_favorites-personaliza:
# Favorites & Personalization

## Overview
Favorites and personalization features form a key pillar of the AI Mall backend, allowing users to curate preferred products and experiences while leveraging AI-driven insights. This document defines the requirements and flows for favorites management (single, batch, snapshotting), custom alerts, and the integration of AI-powered recommendation systems, clearly scoped for the backend layer.

## Objectives
- Enable robust, scalable management of user favorites (add, remove, batch manage, snapshot for history/analytics)
- Facilitate granular alerting and notification mechanisms for user-specified product changes (e.g., price drop, restock, promo)
- Integrate with AI modules to deliver highly relevant, continuously updated product recommendations
- Maintain a clean abstraction boundary for backend services to allow for seamless expansion and evolution

## User Roles & Access
| Role      | Capabilities                                                      |
|-----------|--------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Customer  | Manage product favorites, set custom product alerts, view/personalize recommendations |
| Seller    | View trend analytics on wishlisted products, adjust stock/marketing tactics based on favorites/personalization data |
| Admin     | Oversee system-wide personalization rules, batch modify favorites, enforce audit/compliance |
| AI-Agent  | Access and process anonymized favorite/personalization data for modeling and recommendations |

## Features

### Favorites Management
- Add/remove products to user favorites (atomic and batch)
- Retrieve full favorite list or segmented snapshots (by date, product type, etc.)
- Favorites snapshotting for historical analytics and rollback (periodic and on-demand)
- Batch operations: Add/remove multiple items at once; handle large user lists efficiently
- Favorites limit per user, configurable by role or plan
- Data integrity: Strict transactionality on batch updates

### Alerts & Notifications
- User-configurable: Price drop, new stock, flash sale, low inventory, expiring deals, custom criteria
- Flexible frequency: Immediate, digest (daily/weekly), or threshold-based
- Delivery: Integration with system-wide notification infrastructure
- Admin dashboard for reviewing alert configuration patterns and usage metrics

### Personalization & AI Recommendations
- Personalized feed based on favorites, browsing/purchase history, and explicit preferences
- Real-time update and feedback learning loop (actions refine future recommendations)
- Option to tune data input weights (e.g., prioritize favorites over history)
- AI layer must respect privacy and anonymization policies
- Bulk ranking/export APIs for sellers and admins

## Non-Functional Requirements
- Scalability: Handle spikes in favorite/add/remove and personalization requests, especially during major campaigns
- Latency: Critical workflows (e.g., adding/removing favorites, generating recommendations) should complete within 2s
- Data Isolation: Strong user-data partitioning; private recommendations
- Robust Error Handling: Clear reporting of conflicts or batch partial failures
- Auditability: All favorites and personalization actions logged for compliance

## Acceptance Criteria
- All user-facing API endpoints are documented and support atomic and batch operations
- Role-based access control is strictly enforced throughout all favorite and personalization features
- Integration with AI-agent modules is modular (swap/upgrade models without breaking existing flows)
- Admins can reliably query, audit, and export favorites and personalization data
- No external or cross-file links exist; all context remains within this document

## ERD (Entity Relationship Diagram)
```mermaid
erDiagram
    USER ||--o{ FAVORITE : has
    PRODUCT ||--o{ FAVORITE : favorited_by
    USER ||--o{ ALERT : configures
    PRODUCT ||--o{ ALERT : observed_for
    USER ||--o{ PERSONALIZATION_PROFILE : owns
    PERSONALIZATION_PROFILE ||--o{ RECOMMENDATION : generates
```

---
End of Favorites & Personalization documentation.

# AI Mall Backend  Architecture & Extensibility

## Overview
The AI Mall Backend system is architected to support modularity, scalability, and rapid onboarding of new business channels and services. Its layered approach, combined with clear separation of concerns, provides robust foundations essential for agile business evolution in e-commerce.

---

## 1. Architectural Principles
- **Layered Architecture:** Decouples API, business logic, and data persistence/storage layers for maintainability.
- **API Gateway:** Single entry point for channel-specific and shared APIs; supports REST and GraphQL for client flexibility.
- **Service-Oriented Modules:** Core subsystems (User, Product, Order, Review, Personalization, etc.) are modularized for independent scalability.
- **Statelessness:** Services designed for horizontal scaling with minimal coupling and state managed centrally (e.g., distributed cache/db).
- **Multi-Tenant Support:** Logical tenant isolation at both the data and API layers to serve multiple brands, sellers, and partners.
- **Observability:** Centralized logging and monitoring for all channel interactions and internal service communications.

---

## 2. Core Extensibility Mechanisms
- **Plug-in Service Architecture:** Each core business feature (e.g., loyalty, reviews, personalization, channel-specific UIs) can be added or upgraded without reworking the platform core.
- **Channel/Section Management:**
  - Channels (web, mobile, 3rd-party integrations) register via config or service discovery.
  - Dynamic section/component loading and routing for content, offers, categories, etc.
- **Content & Media Storage:**
  - Abstracted file/media storage (S3, GCS, etc.): enables consistent access, CDN integration, and flexible media workflows.
  - Metadata-driven referencing for banners, product images, AI-generated content.
- **Scalable API Layer:**
  - API versioning and route-mapping allow backward-compatible extensions.
  - Automated channel/role-based authentication and authorization integration.
- **Event & Message Bus:**
  - All core domain events (order placed, stock updated, review posted, etc.) are propagated via message bus for decoupled triggers, inter-service workflows, and seamless new feature integration.

---

## 3. Onboarding New Channels & Services
- **Channel Registration Flow:**
  1. Admin configures new channel/brand profile using API or UI.
  2. Channel-specific settings, UIs, and workflows are defined using templates.
  3. Integration keys/secrets generated for secure access.
  4. Channel routes/content are exposed via the unified API Gateway.
- **Dynamic Feature Toggle:** New features and experimental modules can be deployed gradually to selected channels/segments without redeploying core system.
- **Role & Policy Management:** Every new channel/service is mapped against role definitions (see [roles](./01_ai-mall-backend_roles.md)) for tailored permissions, data access, and user interfaces.
- **Extending Data Models:** Polymorphic data stores (e.g., dynamic fields, document-db) and data dictionary management enable custom attributes per channel/service without schema rewrites.

---

## 4. Scalability & Future-Proofing
- **Horizontal Scaling:** All stateless services can be auto-scaled; stateful resources utilize managed scaling and partitioning (e.g., sharded databases, distributed cache).
- **Service Discovery & Health Checks:** Ensures resilient routing and high availability for all integrations.
- **Modular Upgrade Path:** New functionality can be introduced in isolation and promoted to stable channels after validation; rollback is supported for faulty channel/service rollouts.
- **API Extensibility:** API schemas are structured for easy extension; future AI-powered endpoints, 3rd-party integrations, and custom verticals can be onboarded with minimal friction.

---

## References
- [Roles & Permissions](./01_ai-mall-backend_roles.md)
- [User Management](./02_ai-mall-backend_user-management.md)
- [Business Rules & Security](./09_ai-mall-backend_business-rules-security.md)
- [Compliance & Accessibility](./10_ai-mall-backend_compliance-accessibility.md)

# AI Mall Backend: Business Rules & Security

## Overview
This document defines the comprehensive business logic, security policies, automation rules, permission models, and data integrity protocols for the AI Mall Backend. It is completely self-contained and details every critical element affecting the operation and protection of the system, including how these intersect with both AI-driven automation and manual processes.

## Core Business Rules
- **Unique Identity Enforcement:** Every user (customer, seller, admin, AI agent) must have a unique system-issued identifier. This ID is required for all transactions, data operations, and system events.
- **Order Lifecycle Management:** Orders transition through well-defined states (e.g., Pending, Confirmed, Shipped, Delivered, Cancelled). State changes trigger system-side logs and, where appropriate, notifications.
- **Inventory Safeguards:** Product quantities are atomically checked and updated on placement/modification/cancellation of orders, preventing overselling and race conditions.
- **Pricing & Promotion Rules:** All discounts, coupons, and promotional benefits are calculated server-side, validated for eligibility, and logged for auditing.
- **User Content Moderation:** Automated AI modules monitor user-generated content (e.g., reviews, inquiries) for compliance and sentiment, flagging violations for manual review when necessary.

## Automation & AI Integration
- **Recommendation AI:** Product recommendations are dynamically generated using anonymized user data and behavioral analytics. All AI models are routinely retrained and validated for fairness and bias reduction.
- **Sentiment & Fraud Detection:** Automated sentiment analysis is used to monitor reviews, while AI agents may flag transactions or users exhibiting abnormal or suspicious patterns.
- **Escalation Workflows:** AI-detected issues (e.g., negative sentiment, suspected fraud) are logged as incidents and escalated to relevant managers or admins for human adjudication. Actions taken are recorded for compliance.

## Security Model
- **Role-Based Access Control (RBAC):** The system enforces strict scope-based permissions by user role (customer, seller, admin, AI agent). Each role only has access to the minimum data and functions required.
- **Authentication & Session Management:** All APIs require secure authentication using tokens. Sessions are time-limited, with inactivity and forced expiration policies in place.
- **API Rate Limiting & Abuse Prevention:** All endpoints have rate limiting, anomaly detection, and automated blocking of abusive or suspicious behavior.
- **Audit Logging:** All critical actions, including data modification, administrative access, and AI-driven interventions, are non-repudiably logged with timestamps, user/agent ID, and action metadata.
- **Sensitive Data Handling:** Personally Identifiable Information (PII), payment credentials, and authentication tokens are encrypted in-transit and at-rest. Access to sensitive data is strictly restricted and monitored.
- **Third-Party Integrations:** All external API calls (e.g., payment, shipping) are validated, signed, and monitored for anomalies.

## Data Integrity & Evidence Protocols
- **Immutable Audit Trail:** All business-critical changes (order creation, payment, product updates, admin changes) are recorded in tamper-evident logs.
- **Integrity Verification:** Data checksums or hashes are used to detect tampering, validated on critical access or export.
- **Incident Documentation:** Security or compliance incidents automatically generate evidence packets, containing event sequences, actor information, and system state snapshots.
- **Role Delegation & Revocation:** Permissions delegation and revocation actions are immediately reflected in access logs and require secondary verification for high-privilege operations.

## Compliance & Accessibility
- **Privacy by Design:** Privacy principles are embedded throughout, including user consent management, right-to-be-forgotten workflows, and minimum necessary data exposure.
- **Accessibility Support:** All user-facing interactions in the backend adhere to accessibility standards, generating responses compatible with assistive technologies and supporting alternative input/output formats where appropriate.
- **Policy Updates:** Periodic reviews ensure that all business rules and security procedures comply with current regulatory requirements.

## Enforcement & Exception Handling
- **Automated Enforcement:** Violations of business rules or security policy automatically trigger system responses (e.g., access revocation, content removal, alerting).
- **Manual Override:** Admins can perform overrides in justified cases; such actions are always logged and reviewed.
- **Continuous Monitoring:** Real-time monitoring and alerting systems detect and respond to business and security rule violations, including potential AI model drift or abuse.

# AI Mall Backend: Compliance, Accessibility, and Legal Requirements

## Overview
This document outlines the comprehensive compliance, legal, accessibility, and internationalization requirements for the AI Mall backend system. It details how customers, sellers, admins, and AI-agents interact with backend services in a manner that is secure, privacy-oriented, and adaptable to both international and regional regulatory frameworks. This ensures the platform is trusted, inclusive, and operates lawfully in diverse markets.

## 1. Regulatory Compliance Framework
### 1.1 General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
- **Purpose:** Safeguard the personal data of EU customers. Applies to all user PII storage, processing, and transfer.
- **Key Controls:**
  - Data minimization and purpose limitation
  - User rights: data access, rectification, erasure ("right to be forgotten")
  - Explicit consent management for data collection/processing
  - Data breach notification workflow
- **Backend Mechanisms:**
  - Role-based access to PII, strict audit logging for admin/user data actions
  - API endpoints for data exports/deletions per user request

### 1.2 California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA)
- **Purpose:** Protect privacy of California residents.
- **Key Features:**
  - Right to know, delete, and opt-out of personal data sale
- **Backend Enforcement:**
  - Deletion and do-not-sell flags in user profiles
  - Logging and reporting per CCPA obligations

### 1.3 Child Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA) & Age Restrictions
- **Mechanism:** Age gate at registration; prevention of underage account creation. Age-specific data handling workflows for flagged accounts.

### 1.4 E-Commerce and Financial Regulations
- **Compliance Scope:** PCI DSS (payments), local/regional digital commerce laws, SOX (if publicly traded), and tax/jurisdictional record keeping.
- **Backend Functions:**
  - Secure encrypted payment data storage
  - Order logs and transaction histories for audit
  - API role restrictions for payment processing (sellers, admins)

### 1.5 Data Residency and Cross-Border Transfer
- **Locality Control:** Support for region-based data storage (e.g., EU, US, KR, etc.)
- **Tooling:** Data tagging, migration APIs, and role controls to ensure data does not leave permitted regions. Location-based onboarding flows.

## 2. Accessibility & Inclusivity
### 2.1 Accessible APIs and Service Interfaces
- **WCAG Compliance** for API-driven UIs: semantic data models, proper error returns, and localization support.
- Machine-readable standard for screen readers and custom client requirements (e.g., alt text, ARIA labels for interface data output).

### 2.2 Multi-Language, Locale, and Timezone Awareness
- Backend maintains user language, locale, and timezone preferences.
- Ensures consistent experience and compliance with local notification and reporting standards.

### 2.3 Assistive Technology Compatibility
- APIs structured to allow assistive clients (voice, tactile, or AI agents) to consume data meaningfully, with attention to clear metadata and actionable cues.

## 3. Internationalization (i18n) & Regionalization
- Support for localized formats: currency, number, address, names, and identity verification.
- Calendar and fiscal period support for global sellers/admins.
- Regulatory region flags in user/seller/admin profiles for tailored compliance workflows.

## 4. Security & Privacy Safeguards
- **Role-based Access Control (RBAC):** Strict mapping of permissions to roles (customer, seller, admin, ai-agent)
- **Encryption:** Data at rest and in transit using standards (AES, TLS)
- **Audit Logging:** Immutable audit trails for all sensitive actions; regular review and anomaly detection
- **Incident Response:** Predefined workflow for notifying users, partners, and regulators of breaches or non-compliance

## 5. Acceptance Criteria & Testing
- Automated test suites for regulatory workflows (e.g., erasure, export, age-gating)
- Accessibility validation in API outputs
- Regional compliance checklists before production deployment

## 6. References & Linked Documents
- [System Roles and Responsibilities](./01_ai-mall-backend_roles.md)
- [Business Rules & Security](./09_ai-mall-backend_business-rules-security.md)
- [Architecture & Extensibility](./08_ai-mall-backend_architecture-extensibility.md)

---
Is there anything else to refine or expand for compliance, accessibility, or regional obligations?
